description: Retrieves the specified pools or all pools associated with your Amazon Web Services account. If you specify pool IDs, the output includes information for only the specified pools. If you specify filters, the output includes information for only those pools that meet the filter criteria. If you don't specify pool IDs or filters, the output includes information for all pools. If you specify a pool ID that isn't valid, an error is returned. A pool is a collection of phone numbers and SenderIds. A pool can include one or more phone numbers and SenderIds that are associated with your Amazon Web Services account.

parameters.name: PoolIds
parameters.description: The unique identifier of pools to find. This is an array of strings that can be either the PoolId or PoolArn. (string) ---

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: An array of PoolFilter objects to filter the results. (dict) --- The information for a pool that meets a specified criteria. The name of the attribute to filter on. An array values to filter for. (string) ---

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name of the attribute to filter on.

nested_params.name: Values
nested_params.description: An array values to filter for.

nested_items.name: Pools
nested_items.description: An array of PoolInformation objects that contain the details for the requested pools.

nested_items.name: PoolArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the pool.

nested_items.name: PoolId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the pool.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status of the pool.

nested_items.name: MessageType
nested_items.description: The type of message. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL for messages that are critical or time-sensitive and PROMOTIONAL for messages that aren't critical or time-sensitive.

nested_items.name: TwoWayEnabled
nested_items.description: When set to true you can receive incoming text messages from your end recipients using the TwoWayChannelArn.

nested_items.name: TwoWayChannelArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the two way channel.

nested_items.name: TwoWayChannelRole
nested_items.description: An optional IAM Role Arn for a service to assume, to be able to post inbound SMS messages.

nested_items.name: SelfManagedOptOutsEnabled
nested_items.description: When set to false, an end recipient sends a message that begins with HELP or STOP to one of your dedicated numbers, AWS End User Messaging SMS and Voice automatically replies with a customizable message and adds the end recipient to the OptOutList. When set to true you're responsible for responding to HELP and STOP requests. You're also responsible for tracking and honoring opt-out requests. For more information see Self-managed opt-outs.

nested_items.name: OptOutListName
nested_items.description: The name of the OptOutList associated with the pool.

nested_items.name: SharedRoutesEnabled
nested_items.description: Allows you to enable shared routes on your pool.

nested_items.name: DeletionProtectionEnabled
nested_items.description: When set to true the pool can't be deleted.

nested_items.name: CreatedTimestamp
nested_items.description: The time when the pool was created, in UNIX epoch time format.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to be used for the next set of paginated results. If this field is empty then there are no more results.
